results.title: Moses Coady
results.creator_credit: Kent Martin, F Whitman Trecartin, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film is about Moses Coady, who was called many things in his lifetime, but who proved to be the most effective social reformer Canada has known. He went into the villages, organized the people into study groups, helped them set up credit unions and co-operatives, and freed them from the semi-feudal conditions they lived in. Today, people from all over the world come to study his methods at the Coady International Institute in Antigonish, Nova Scotia. Voice and narration: Joan Orenstein.

results.title: Mosaic experiments
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau, Visual Education Films and Robert Longini
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the techniques, basic elements, and creative aspects of the mosaic medium. Experiments in tesserae, smalti, and Blenke glass which emphasise the richness in variety of materials and forms. Stresses the possibilities of using new and unusual structural elements - bathroom tiles, buttons, pebbles - and points out how commercially available elements can be used in new ways.

results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Norman McLaren and Evelyn Lambart
results.brief_description: A picture of unusual movement, colour and sound, created in a unusual way. It is an example of “op” art in film, a play on the retina of the eye. Basis of the film is a single tiny square that divides, eventually forming a colourful mosaic to the animators musical orchestration. (Awards: New York; Melbourne; Buenos Aires; Vancouver.)

results.title: Moruroa: the big secret
results.creator_credit: Michael Daeron, Pointe du Jour, Arte and La Sept
results.brief_description: This award-winning documentary examines the destructive nature of nuclear bomb testing around Tahiti’s Moruroa Atoll by the French government. Since the 1960s the atoll has been the site of around 180 tests producing radiation levels 850 times greater than that created by the Hiroshima blast in 1945. Contrary to France’s claim that the tests posed no danger to the people of the region, the film reveals, through interviews with some of the 20,000 Tahitian workers employed at the test site, that radiation has had a devastating effect on their health and well being and that of their families. Although the French ceased testing in the Pacific in 1996, their decision to conduct a final series of tests in 1995 was greeted with worldwide condemnation. With one of the highest cancer rates in the world, Tahitians living in the area are still paying the price of the French military’s refusal to acknowledge their concerns. A study guide accompanies the film, which is suitable for secondary students, and teachers of Studies of Society and Environment, Pacific history, English issues, Geography and Environmental studies.

results.title: Mortgage
results.creator_credit: Bruce Moir, Film Australia and Bill Bennett
results.brief_description: An absorbing docu-drama about a young couple who, in trying to buy and build a house, find themselves in a spiralling nightmare world of deceit, incompetence and rising interest rates. The film shows the couple’s growing awareness and acceptance of emotional and financial responsibility. Like the companion films Custody and Malpractice this is a cautionary tale in the form of docu-drama, offering no easy answers or simplified dramatic conflict, instead seeking to create a sense of lived experience while dramatising the issues involved. The key characters are played by actors with architects, solicitors and government services officials playing themselves. Cast includes Doris Younane, Brian Vriends, Bruce Venables and Andrew Gilbert.

results.title: Mort D'un Guide = Death of a Guide
results.brief_description:
In July 1974, Michel Servoz, a mountain guide based in Chamonix and his trainee, Patric Falavier, are reported missing in the Massif des Drus. Merinchal, a journalist who had previously interviewed Servoz, decides to cover the search and rescue operation. When he reaches Chamonix, he realises that Servoz and Chevalier were not on an ordinary training run but were attempting to open a new way to the top of the Drus. This made for TV film details with a documentary precision the close knit community of moutain guides. It contains stunning rock climbing sequences.

Credits: Director, Jacques Ertaud ; writer, Henry Grange ; photography, Rene Vernardet, Louis Miaille, Georges Orset ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Victor Lanoux, Pierre Rousseau, Georges Claisse, Jean Valmont.

results.title: Morris loves Jack
results.brief_description: An off-beat romance between a policewoman and the charming but feckless unemployed actor who shares her house and her money. She is happy to support him emotionally and financially, in spite of his irresponsible attitude to life until she finds him in the arms of “another”. Cast includes Kris McQuade, John Hargreaves, Bill Hunter, David Boyd.
